othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Users with required permissions can select workflow participants who will handle different workflow statuses on form records.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: select workflow users for form processes

ul.li: Workflows are published for the form.
You have the required permissions to view and use the feature.

context.p: Atany workflow status, you can select specific usersto mandatorily take an action at theworkflow status. These selected users must perform an action at the defined workflow status to transition the workflowto the subsequent workflow status. Only selected workflow users will need to perform the workflow action.

For document folders in the document management module, user selection defined at a folder level is applicable to allsub-folders and document records within it. Also, user selection is possibleat a sub-folder level and also at document record level.

li.p: To select users in a workflow of a module, or document folder, perform the following steps:
In the list page of a form or list page ofdocument folder, clickWorkflow, and then clickWorkflow User(s).
From theAvailable Workflowsdrop-down list, select a workflow.
The published workflows associated with the form are displayed.
The list of stakeholders for each status and role is displayed.
Alternatively, to select users in a workflow of a record of a form or a document, perform the following step:

ul.li:
Select a record, click Workflow, and then clickWorkflow User(s).
TheWORKFLOW USER(S)page with the associated workflow of the record is displayed.
Only workflow statuses following the current workflow statusare displayed, and the list of stakeholders for each status is displayed.

li.p: Select the users in each status to add to the workflow.

Optionally, you can filter the users using the following filters:
Stage
Role
User Name
First Name
Last Name
For more information on using filters, refer to .
Based on the workflow definition, any or all selected users must perform the workflow action on the selected record.
TheWORKFLOW HISTORYpage displays the workflow actions performed by all users across all statuses of the workflow. For information on workflow history, refer to Viewing the Workflow History.
